en: By the rivers of Babylon, There we sat down, yea, we wept, When we remembered Zion.
hmr: Babulon vadung pangahai, Chutaka chun kan ṭhung a; anih, kan ṭap hlak, Zion kan ngaituoin.

en: Upon the willows in the midst thereof We hanged up our harps.
hmr: Vadung laia phahrâmhaia chun, Kan ṭingṭanghai kan bâng hlak a.

en: For there they that led us captive required of us songs, And they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
hmr: “Zion hla pakhat mi sakpêk ro,” tiin, Chutaka chun sala mi ṭhuoituhaiin hlasak dingin an mi phût a: A mi sukrimsituhaiin hlim dingin an mi phût bawk hlak sih a.

en: How shall we sing Jehovah’s song In a foreign land?
hmr: Mi ramahai chun LALPA hla iengtin am sak thei kan tih a?

en: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, Let my right hand forget her skill.
hmr: Aw Jerusalem, ka theinghil che chun, Ka kut changtieng hin a thil thiem hi theinghil ve raw se.

en: Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth, If I remember thee not; If I prefer not Jerusalem Above my chief joy.
hmr: Ka hriet zing naw che chun, Ka lei hi ka dangah kawp tlat raw se; Ka hlimna tak nêka Jerusalem ka dit lem naw chun.

en: Remember, O Jehovah, against the children of Edom The day of Jerusalem; Who said, Rase it, rase it, Even to the foundation thereof.
hmr: Aw LALPA, Jerusalem ni chu Edom thlahai chungah a se tiengin hre zing rawh: “A lungphûm chen khawmin, Sukchim ro, sukchim ro,” tituhai kha.

en: O daughter of Babylon, that art to be destroyed, Happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee As thou hast served us.
hmr: Aw Babulon naunu, sukbo- hmanga um ding, Kan chunga i thaw anga, Thung ding che chu lâwmtakin um a tih.

en: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones Against the rock.
hmr: I nau le têhai lâkpêk cheha, lungpui vuoknaa hmangtu ding chu, Lâwmtakin um a tih.
